content:
A mixture of CuCl2·3H2O (0.051 g, 0.3 mmol), 4-dpyb (0.03 g, 0.1 mmol), 5-H2MIP (0.027 g, 0.15 mmol), H2O (12 mL) and NaOH (0.018 g, 0.46 mmol) was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a 25 mL Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 120 °C for 4 days. After slowly cooling to room temperature, blue block crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: ca. 25 % based on Cu). Anal. for C25H28CuN4O8: calcd. C 52.08, H 4.90, N 9.72; found C 52.01, H 4.93, N 9.76 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): ν = 3388 w, 3284 w, 3070 w, 2928 w, 1653 s, 1617 s, 1572 s, 1547 s, 1497 m, 1420 m, 1353 s, 1224 m, 1194 w, 1107 s, 1071 m, 1024 w, 980 w, 858 s, 773 s, 727 s, 622 m, 519 w.

Synthesis of [Cu(4-dpyb)(5-HAIP)<sub>2</sub>] (<bold>2</bold>)

The synthesis method of 2 is similar to that of 1 except for ligand 5-H2AIP (0.018 g, 0.1 mmol) as the substitute of 5-H2MIP, and the different amount of NaOH (0.018 g, 0.46 mmol) was added to adjust the systematic pH. Blue block crystals of 2 were obtained (yield: ca. 33 % based on Cu). Anal. for C32H30CuN6O10: calcd. C 53.17, H 4.19, N 11.63; found C 53.19, H 4.15, N 11.60 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): ν = 3373 m, 3278 m, 3079 w, 2938 w, 1711 m, 1628 s, 1614 s, 1567 s, 1541 s, 1478 m, 1429 m, 1380 s, 1368 m, 1327 m, 1214 m, 1186 m, 1077 m, 1048 m, 1025 w, 933 w, 868 s, 781 s, 715 s, 634 m, 522 w.

Synthesis of [Cu(4-dpyb)<sub>0.5</sub>(2,6-PDA)]·H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>3</bold>)

The synthesis method of 3 is similar to that of 2 except for ligand 2,6-H2PDA (0.025 g, 0.15 mmol) as the substitute of 5-H2AIP, and the different amount of NaOH (0.016 g, 0.40 mmol) was added to adjust the systematic pH. Blue block crystals of 3 were obtained (yield: ca. 37 % based on Cu). Anal. for C15H14CuN3O6: Calcd. C 45.47, H 3.57, N 10.61; found C 45.41, H 3.59, N 10.67 %. IR (KBr, cm−1): ν = 3428 w, 3081 w, 2948 w, 1658 m, 1622 s, 1672 w, 1430 m, 1367 s, 1349 m, 1298 w, 1107 s, 912 w, 859 m, 786 s, 737 m, 620 s, 525 w.
clean_text:
Synthesis of [Cu(4-dpyb)(5-MIP)(H2O)]⋅H2O (1)

A mixture of CuCl2⋅3H2O (0.051 g, 0.3 mmol), 4-dpyb (0.03 g, 0.1 mmol), 5-H2MIP (0.027 g, 0.15 mmol), H2O (12 mL) and NaOH (0.018 g, 0.46 mmol) was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a 25 mL Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 120 °C for 4 days. After slowly cooling to room temperature, blue block crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: ca. 25 % based on Cu). Anal. for C25H28CuN4O8: calcd. C 52.08, H 4.90, N 9.72; found C 52.01, H 4.93, N 9.76 %. IR (KBr, cm-1): ν = 3388 w, 3284 w, 3070 w, 2928 w, 1653 s, 1617 s, 1572 s, 1547 s, 1497 m, 1420 m, 1353 s, 1224 m, 1194 w, 1107 s, 1071 m, 1024 w, 980 w, 858 s, 773 s, 727 s, 622 m, 519 w.

Synthesis of [Cu(4-dpyb)(5-HAIP)2] (2)

The synthesis method of 2 is similar to that of 1 except for ligand 5-H2AIP (0.018 g, 0.1 mmol) as the substitute of 5-H2MIP, and the different amount of NaOH (0.018 g, 0.46 mmol) was added to adjust the systematic pH. Blue block crystals of 2 were obtained (yield: ca. 33 % based on Cu). Anal. for C32H30CuN6O10: calcd. C 53.17, H 4.19, N 11.63; found C 53.19, H 4.15, N 11.60 %. IR (KBr, cm-1): ν = 3373 m, 3278 m, 3079 w, 2938 w, 1711 m, 1628 s, 1614 s, 1567 s, 1541 s, 1478 m, 1429 m, 1380 s, 1368 m, 1327 m, 1214 m, 1186 m, 1077 m, 1048 m, 1025 w, 933 w, 868 s, 781 s, 715 s, 634 m, 522 w.

Synthesis of [Cu(4-dpyb)0.5(2,6-PDA)]⋅H2O (3)

The synthesis method of 3 is similar to that of 2 except for ligand 2,6-H2PDA (0.025 g, 0.15 mmol) as the substitute of 5-H2AIP, and the different amount of NaOH (0.016 g, 0.40 mmol) was added to adjust the systematic pH. Blue block crystals of 3 were obtained (yield: ca. 37 % based on Cu). Anal. for C15H14CuN3O6: Calcd. C 45.47, H 3.57, N 10.61; found C 45.41, H 3.59, N 10.67 %. IR (KBr, cm-1): ν = 3428 w, 3081 w, 2948 w, 1658 m, 1622 s, 1672 w, 1430 m, 1367 s, 1349 m, 1298 w, 1107 s, 912 w, 859 m, 786 s, 737 m, 620 s, 525 w.
